articles.author: Jaimi Dowdell, Lena Masri, Giulia Paravicini, Ryan Mcneill, Nafisa Eltahir
articles.description: The Trump administration’s effort to slash and reshape American foreign aid is crippling the intricate global system that aims to prevent and respond to famine.
articles.title: Halt in U.S. aid cripples global efforts to relieve hunger

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli Defence Minister Israel Katz ordered the army on Thursday to prepare a plan to allow the "voluntary departure" of residents from the Gaza strip, Israeli media reported.
articles.title: Israel's defense minister orders army to prepare for Gaza residents' departure, media reports

articles.author: Daniel Wiessner, Tim Reid, Nathan Layne
articles.description: The judge could opt to delay the buyout further or block it on a more permanent basis when he next considers the legal challenge by the unions at a hearing on Monday.
articles.title: US judge blocks Trump buyout program as 60,000 sign up to quit

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Philippine Vice President Sara Duterte said on Friday she had been preparing since last year for impeachment and would welcome on her defence team her firebrand father, former President Rodrigo Duterte, if interested to join.
articles.title: Philippines'  VP Duterte prepared for impeachment, father welcome to join defence team

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A contingent of 144 additional Kenyan police arrived in the Haitian capital of Port-au-Prince on Thursday, part of a multinational security force backed by the United Nations.
articles.title: New contingent of Kenyan police arrive in Haitian capital

articles.author: Simon Lewis, Leah Douglas, Lisa Baertlein
articles.description: The U.N. World Food Programme (WFP) was ordered by Washington to stop work on dozens of U.S.-funded grants, according to an email seen by Reuters, that was sent five days after Secretary of State Marco Rubio issued a waiver for emergency food assistance.
articles.title: UN food agency WFP received dozens of US stop work orders despite emergency waiver

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Eight Ukrainian children seized from their families by officials in the Russia-annexed and controlled Crimea peninsula and placed in state orphanages returned home on Thursday, a senior Ukrainian official said.
articles.title: Ukrainian children forcibly taken from their families brought home, official says

articles.author: Elida Moreno
articles.description: Panama President Jose Raul Mulino said on Thursday the U.S. was spreading "lies and falsehoods" after the State Department claimed U.S. government vessels would be able to pass through the Panama Canal without paying.
articles.title: Panama president to US: stop 'lies and falsehoods' about canal

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump's special envoy for Ukraine and Russia, Keith Kellogg, had a "thorough discussion" with Ukraine's ambassador to Washington in their first official meeting on Thursday, the ambassador said.
articles.title: Trump's Ukraine, Russia envoy meets Ukrainian ambassador

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: A key safety system was turned off on a U.S. Army helicopter that collided with an American Airlines regional jet last week near Washington Reagan Airport, killing 67.
articles.title: Key safety system off in Army helicopter that collided with American Airlines jet, senator says
